intro: Alsodeia echinocarpa, commonly known as the spiny fruit alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense, branched inflorescences. Its fruit is a distinctive, spiny capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Alsodeia echinocarpa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
